meanings.definition: A class that is higher in the hierarchy than another class.
meanings.sent1: In the animal kingdom, the lion is considered the superclass of the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The CEO belongs to the superclass of the company's executives.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was jokingly referred to as the superclass of all caped crusaders.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity made her the superclass of friends.
meanings.sent5: The majestic oak tree stood as the superclass of the forest, towering over all other plants.

meanings.definition: A class from which one or more other classes are derived.
meanings.sent1: The original painting served as the superclass for all the prints made from it.
meanings.sent2: The ancient language is the superclass from which many modern dialects have evolved.
meanings.sent3: The recipe book is the superclass of all the delicious meals we enjoy.
meanings.sent4: His groundbreaking research paper became the superclass for future scientific studies.
meanings.sent5: The classic novel remains the superclass for countless literary works that followed.
